intro: Lantana aristata var. brachypoda, commonly known as the narrowleaf lantana, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and swampy areas. It has opposite, narrow leaves and produces small, four-lobed fruits. Lantana aristata var. brachypoda is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to wet, saline environments.
